title: Why aren't the Packers dominating everyone? Solak's Week 9 lessons, plus trade deadline bingo
content: Ben Solak sizes up the underperforming Packers, J.J. McCarthy's return, what could happen at the trade deadline and some Week 9 trends to watch.

title: Power Rankings: 1-32 poll, plus each team's most important remaining game
content: Let's update our countdown ahead of Week 10 and pick out a critical game on the schedule for every team.

title: Cowboys trade for Wilson, hope LB bolsters D
content: The Dallas Cowboys have acquired veteran linebacker Logan Wilson in a trade with the Cincinnati Bengals.

title: Bucks back Turner with win after ex-Pacer booed
content: Myles Turner was disheartened by the boos he got from Pacers fans in his return to Indiana, but Milwaukee got the last laugh with Giannis Antetokounmpo's buzzer-beater sealing the win.

title: Morant mum on feelings after return from ban
content: Grizzlies star Ja Morant returned from his one-game suspension and had 18 points and 10 assists in a loss to the Pistons.

title: Sources: ChiSox picking up Robert's $20M option
content: The White Sox are picking up the $20 million option on center fielder Luis Robert Jr.'s contract for the 2026 season, sources told ESPN.

title: Gannon: Brissett still backup after win vs. Dallas
content: Despite Jacoby Brissett leading the Cardinals to their first win since mid-September, coach Jonathan Gannon said he isn't changing course on his starting quarterback.

title: Ravens get edge rusher Jones in trade with Titans
content: The Ravens have acquired edge rusher Dre'Mont Jones from the Titans in exchange for a conditional fifth-round pick on Monday.

title: Conte, architect of BALCO scandal, dies at 75
content: Victor Conte, the architect of a scheme to provide undetectable performance-enhancing drugs to professional athletes, including baseball stars Barry Bonds, Jason Giambi and Olympic track champion Marion Jones decades ago, died Monday. He was 75.

title: Peat wows in debut as Arizona beats No. 3 Florida
content: Freshman Koa Peat scored 30 points to lead No. 13 Arizona to a 93-87 win over third-ranked and reigning national champion Florida in the Hall of Fame Series on Monday night.

title: NFL trade grades: Will Dre'Mont Jones upgrade the Ravens?
content: Let's size up deals leading into the Tuesday NFL trade deadline, including the Ravens getting pass-rush help.

title: Big night for freshmen, more surprises and takeaways from men's openers
content: Koa Peat's 30 points in the Wildcats' win over the reigning champs highlights big night of freshmen debuts.

title: A top-10 upset, Latson's Gamecocks debut and an Iowa breakout
content: Baylor's top-10 upset of Duke and Ta'Niya Latson's 20-point debut helped open the women's 2025-26 season Monday.

title: The real Azzi Fudd?  'None of you have seen it'
content: The Most Outstanding Player of last year's Final Four has shown her peak powers only in small glimpses. Now Azzi Fudd is ready to level up for the Huskies' repeat bid.

title: Why the Cavaliers are doubling down despite two straight playoff disappointments
content: After two disappointing playoff exits, the Cavaliers aren't making any major changes to their schemes or plans. In fact, they're doubling down.

title: Are the Spurs actually a contender? Debating four early-season storylines
content: ESPN national analysts Zach Kram and Kevin Pelton debate the biggest early-season questions about Victor Wembanyama, Austin Reaves, Cooper Flagg and more.

title: MLB All-October team: The stars who ruled the 2025 playoffs
content: From playoff breakouts to World Series heroes, here's a full squad of players who shined brightest under the postseason lights.

title: From Kyle Schwarber to Alex Bregman: Best fits for top free agents
content: Free agency starts Thursday at 5 p.m. ET. Here are some pairings we'd love to see as this winter gets underway.

title: NHL Awards Watch: Eichel leading for MVP after one month
content: We polled PHWA voters to find out who's ahead in the major races after one month of the 2025-26 season.

title: Buzz:  Jacoby Brissett, Marvin Harrison Jr., Cards RBs and key injuries from Sunday
content: Brissett shines on MNF, Cardinals RBs continue to befuddle, plus injuries to note from Sunday's games.

title: Predicting the rest of the Premier League season: How all 20 teams will finish
content: After 10 games, we now have enough data to predict every Premier League team's final spot in the standings for the 2025-26 season.

title: How much do Barça depend on Pedri? With midfielder injured, we're about to find out
content: Pedri's injury comes at a critical time for Barcelona and Spain, both of whom rely on his unique skills.

title: First bets for Week 10: Browns and Eagles to cover in Week 10, plus an MVP pick
content: What lines offered immediate value once odds came out? Here are four early bets and a futures wager to track.

title: Is Logan Paul replacing Seth Rollins in The Vision?
content: Heading toward Survivor Series: WarGames next month, CM Punk and The Usos isn't the only alliance taking form.

title: Pickups: Ryan Rollins, Quentin Grimes add instant offense
content: Every week in fantasy basketball, there are available players who can help fill holes in your roster. Here are the ones to add for the week ahead.

title: Pakistan to deploy new submarines in 2026 — what it means for India’s naval strategy
content: Pakistan's naval strength is set to significantly increase next year with the induction of eight advanced Chinese-made Hangor-class submarines, featuring air-independent propulsion. This development poses a challenge to India's current conventional submarine capabilities, which are still awaiting their own building plans to commence. The move enhances Pakistan's maritime A2/AD posture.

title: Asia Cup controversy: ICC takes action against Pakistan's Haris Rauf; Suryakumar Yadav fined
content: The International Cricket Council has revealed penalties from the Asia Cup 2025.  Incidents during India versus Pakistan matches led to hearings.  Suryakumar Yadav received a fine and demerit points.  Sahibzada Farhan was given a warning and a demerit point.  Haris Rauf also faced a fine and demerit points for his conduct.

title: '10% control the Army': Rahul's caste claim in Bihar, says 90% Indians 'nowhere to be found'
content: Rahul Gandhi on Tuesday alleged that 10 percent of the population, referring to upper castes, control the Army and judiciary, while 90 percent from backward communities are excluded from power. He also criticised the Bihar government for unemployment, stating it has turned the state's youth into laborers across the country.

title: Big AI freebie: ChatGPT Go now free for 12 months in India; how to claim the offer
content: OpenAI is offering ChatGPT Go free for 12 months to users in India starting November 4, 2025. Eligible users include new sign-ups, free-tier users, and existing ChatGPT Go subscribers with accounts in good standing. The promotion provides access to GPT-5, advanced image generation, file uploads, data analysis tools, and custom GPTs at no cost. Users must add a payment method to redeem but won't be charged during the promotional period. This limited-time offer can be redeemed via web, Android, or iOS platforms.

title: Watch: Coach collapses mid-match, dies; players break down in heartbreaking scenes
content: Radnicki 1923 head coach Mladen Zizovic tragically passed away at 44 after collapsing during a Serbian SuperLiga match. The game was halted, and despite medical attention, Zizovic died at a nearby hospital. The match was later abandoned as players and staff reacted with profound grief. Zizovic was 44 at the time of his death.

title: ‘admin123’ opened 50,000 cameras: How bots breached CCTVs, obscene clips sold; steps to prevent
content: Hackers exploited weak default passwords on CCTV systems, stealing 50,000 clips from hospitals and other institutions over nine months. They sold the footage on Telegram for profit, using automated tools to breach and harvest data. This highlights a critical need for institutions to implement basic cybersecurity measures.

title: Cleared all police tests but lost job before joining; man wins case in HC
content: A man named Rawal, selected for a Constable job, lost his chance due to judicial custody and a missed 30-day joining deadline. The Punjab and Haryana High Court reinstated his appointment, ruling that rigid adherence to non-statutory instructions shouldn't deny a deserving candidate a job after clearing a tough selection process.

title: YouTube TV blackout: Read email company sent to Disney leaders; rejects their request
content: Disney and YouTube TV are locked in a dispute. Disney wants its ABC channel back on YouTube TV for election coverage. YouTube TV refused, citing subscriber viewing habits and alternative news sources. Both companies are negotiating a new distribution agreement. Disney's channels, including ESPN and ABC, are currently unavailable to YouTube TV subscribers.

title: Dick Cheney: 'Darth Vader' who hated Donald Trump
content: Cheney died in November 2025 at the age of 84 from complications of pneumonia and heart disease. His family called him “a noble giant of a man.” His critics might call him the architect of ruin. But everyone agrees: he reshaped the American presidency, bent the arc of global history, and never once looked back. Long before Trump normalised authoritarian instincts in public, Cheney operationalised them in secret without even bothering to tweet about it. Cheney might have found redemption among Never-Trumper liberals, but for those who have to live in the world, Darth Vader has no redemption — only the haunting echo of the Imperial March.

title: ‘Ensure elimination of all…’: Himanta links Shahabuddin's son to Laden
content: Assam chief minister Himanta Biswa Sarma has targeted RJD candidate Osama Shahab in Bihar. Sarma drew a controversial comparison between Shahab and Osama Bin Laden. He stated that Shahab's victory would be a setback for Hindus. Sarma also discussed his work in Assam regarding infiltrators and madrasas. He announced plans for a law against multiple marriages in Assam.

title: Delhi India's 6th most polluted city in October; Dharuhera worst— see full list
content: Delhi ranked sixth most polluted city in India in October, with PM2.5 levels nearly tripling from September. A CREA report highlighted a sharp air quality drop across the Indo-Gangetic Plain, with Dharuhera in Haryana topping the list. The findings underscore the impact of year-round pollution sources beyond seasonal factors.

title: Jeff Bezos’ ex-wife’s gift: MacKenzie Scott makes large donation; focus on education
content: MacKenzie Scott has donated $80 million to Howard University, one of the largest single gifts in its history, to support general operations and its College of Medicine. This significant contribution arrives as the university faces delays in federal funding due to a government shutdown. The donation aligns with Scott's ongoing philanthropic focus on diversity, equity, and inclusion initiatives.

title: Maharashtra: Govt renames Islampur in Sangli to Ishwarpur; issues gazette
content: The Maharashtra government officially renamed Islampur in Sangli to Ishwarpur, with the Survey of India granting final approval. This change, following a legislative assembly proposal, aligns with a state-wide trend of renaming cities. While many residents celebrated the restoration of historical identity, others expressed concern, prioritising development over a name change.

title: 'Bachaa hai': Tej Pratap's 'jhunjhuna' jibe at Tejashwi; threatens to campaign in Raghopur
content: JJD chief Tej Pratap Yadav called his younger brother and Mahagathbandhan's chief ministerial nominee, Tejashwi Yadav, "still a child." He vowed to campaign in Tejashwi's constituency in retaliation for Tejashwi campaigning in his. Tej Pratap also criticised Rahul Gandhi, suggesting he was unfit for politics.

title: Read: How 9/11 shaped the 'Cheney doctrine'
content: On the morning of September 11, 2001, Cheney was in the White House while President George W. Bush was in Florida. As hijacked planes struck New York and Washington, the vice president was ushered into the Presidential Emergency Operations Center beneath the West Wing.

title: 4 sixes, 93 runs! Vaibhav Suryavanshi's explosive reply to India A call-up
content: Teenage batting sensation Vaibhav Suryavanshi impressed on his India A call-up, scoring a rapid 93 off 67 balls in a Ranji Trophy match. The 14-year-old's fiery innings, featuring nine fours and four sixes, showcased his aggressive batting style. Suryavanshi will also feature in the upcoming Rising Stars Asia Cup in Doha.

title: 'Be ready': Mamata leads anti-SIR rally; Abhishek says 'fear claimed 7 lives'
content: West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee led a massive protest in Kolkata against the Special Intensive Revision of electoral rolls, alleging "silent invisible rigging" by the BJP and Election Commission. The TMC claims the revision, the first since 2002, is a ploy to manipulate voter lists before the 2026 Assembly elections, while the BJP hails it as a transparency measure.

title: Blake Treinen’s viral Charlie Kirk hat: What’s the real story?
content: A viral photo of Blake Treinen wearing a "Charlie Kirk" hat was falsely linked to the Dodgers' 2025 World Series win. The image actually dates back to a September 12 game, weeks before the championship, honoring a fallen TPUSA founder. Fact-checkers confirmed Treinen did not wear the tribute hat during the World Series celebration.

title: Brittany Mahomes slams “disgusting” Bills fan stunt ahead of Chiefs vs Bills
content: Ahead of the Chiefs-Bills game, a past incident involving Brittany Mahomes and a fan display in Buffalo has resurfaced. She publicly condemned a disrespectful Kermit the Frog puppet mocking Patrick Mahomes, urging for basic decency. This reminder of respect underscores the intense rivalry, proving that even amidst fierce competition, human dignity remains paramount.

title: Portuguese Man O’ War with jellyfish-like appearance washes up on UK beaches
content: Dangerous Portuguese Man O' War have washed ashore on popular Welsh beaches. Authorities are warning the public to avoid contact with these venomous creatures. Even dead specimens retain their sting. Efforts are underway to remove them. Sightings have also been reported along other UK coastlines. Beachgoers are urged to exercise extreme caution.

title: 'A gentle giant': Sania Mirza reacts as Rohan Bopanna calls time on 22-year career
content: Sania Mirza fondly reflected on her decades-long friendship and partnership with Rohan Bopanna, recalling their first title together when she was just 14. From winning the Nationals to reaching the 2023 Australian Open final, Mirza called Bopanna a “gentle giant” and praised his perseverance as the Coorg-born retired at 45 years old.

title: Russian cardiologist reveals 6 daily habits behind heart failure in healthy people
content: Russian cardiologist Dr Yaranov highlights six hidden lifestyle factors impacting heart health. Poor sleep, air pollution, chronic stress, gum disease, food deserts and gut imbalances silently harm the heart. These modifiable risks can lead to heart failure even in those appearing healthy. Addressing these issues early can protect the heart before clinical disease emerges.

title: What happens to body when one consumes flaxseeds every day for a month
content: Despite their small size, flaxseeds pack quite a punch of nutrients-dietary fiber, omega‑3 fatty acids, an assortment of vitamins, and a handful of essential minerals. When consumed regularly, flaxseeds can trigger positive shifts in your body, most noticeably in digestive function, cardiovascular wellbeing and blood‑sugar regulation

title: 'War on terror' architect: Former US VP Dick Cheney dies at 84; served under George Bush
content: Former US Vice President Dick Cheney, a key architect of the "war on terror" and influential figure during the George W. Bush administration, has passed away. Known for his decades as a powerful Washington player, Cheney later became a vocal critic of Donald Trump, deeming him a significant threat to the nation.

title: Hinduja Group chairman Gopichand P Hinduja, 85 years old, passes away in London
content: Gopichand P Hinduja, Chairman of the Hinduja Group, has passed away in London. He was 85 years old. Hinduja was instrumental in transforming the family business into a global conglomerate.

title: 'If they make too much fuss …': Lalan Singh’s warning sparks row; FIR filed after video examination
content: Union minister Lalan Singh has sparked controversy by urging Janata Dal (United) workers to confine opposition leaders on polling day.  The Rashtriya Janata Dal condemned the remarks, accusing the minister of undermining the Election Commission. This statement comes amid campaigning for a JD(U) candidate currently in jail.

title: 'Put on a whole show about Chhath Puja': Rahul’s ‘drama’ barb at PM Modi; takes swipe at Nitish
content: Rahul Gandhi accused PM Modi of staging a Chhath Puja 'drama,' alleging a special pipe was used for his Yamuna bath. Gandhi also criticized Modi for distracting youth with social media, diverting attention from unemployment and health issues. This exchange occurs amidst a heated Bihar election campaign where Modi had previously targeted the opposition over the festival.

title: IPL trade: What is preventing a KL Rahul switch to KKR - roadblocks in the way
content: Trade talks for KL Rahul ahead of the IPL mini-auction are intensifying, with Kolkata Knight Riders keen on acquiring the wicketkeeper-batter. However, Delhi Capitals are demanding a player of similar stature in return, creating a significant roadblock. DC are already close to a swap involving Sanju Samson and Tristan Stubbs and an uncapped India player.

title: Diversification strategy bears fruit! Non-US markets offset some US export losses
content: India's export diversification strategy is showing early success following a 50% US tariff. Sectors like cotton garments, marine products, and tea are finding new markets in Asia, Europe, and the Middle East, offsetting declines in US shipments. This shift is seen as healthy for India's export growth.

title: Connor McDavid makes history with 1,100th point against Blues
content: Connor McDavid reached a historic milestone, recording his 1,100th career point in the Edmonton Oilers’ win over the St. Louis Blues. The achievement places him among NHL legends Wayne Gretzky, Mario Lemieux, and Mike Bossy as one of the fastest players to reach the mark, further solidifying McDavid’s status as one of hockey’s all-time greats.

title: New regional force? Northeast parties announce merger; Conrad Sangma leads charge
content: Leaders from four Northeast regional parties, including Meghalaya CM Conrad Sangma, have announced plans to merge into a single political entity. This move aims to amplify the region's voice and represent its people's aspirations. A committee will now define the structure and strategy for this historic unification, though some key regional players are currently not participating.

title: Hydrogen can make water on alien worlds: A study just rewrote how planets form oceans
content: Astronomers now understand that water-rich planets can form internally, even close to stars. A new study reveals that high-pressure reactions between hydrogen and molten rock within sub-Neptunes generate vast amounts of water. This discovery challenges previous notions of planetary formation and habitability, suggesting that 'dry' planets can indeed become 'wet' worlds through internal processes.

title: Diamond jewellery & solar panels! IND women rewarded royally; 297% hike in prize money
content: A Surat industrialist is celebrating the Indian women's cricket team's World Cup victory with a unique gift. Each player will receive handcrafted jewellery among other rewards. This gesture, aimed at appreciating their resilience and inspiring millions, highlights a commitment to uplifting both people and the planet. The team's historic win has sparked widespread celebrations.

title: Explosion at Pakistan supreme court: Gas cylinder blast leaves 12 injured - video
content: A gas cylinder blast rocked the Supreme Court of Pakistan's basement cafeteria in Islamabad early Tuesday, injuring about a dozen people. Authorities confirmed a gas leak and ongoing air conditioning repairs as likely causes. The explosion caused the building to shake, with the most severe injuries sustained by technicians. Emergency services responded swiftly, and investigations are underway.

title: Super Bowl LX backlash as 100K fans petition to replace Bad Bunny with George Strait
content: A Change.org petition with over 100,000 signatures is demanding the NFL replace Bad Bunny with country artists for the Super Bowl LX halftime show. Critics cite concerns about family-friendliness and national identity, while the NFL defends the choice for global appeal, highlighting Bad Bunny's immense popularity and economic impact.

title: '43yrs in maximum-security prison': Indian-origin man wrongly jailed in US; court halts deportation
content: Indian-origin man, Subramanyam Vedam, faces deportation from the US after spending over four decades in prison for a murder conviction later overturned.  Despite being a legal permanent resident since infancy, he was taken into immigration custody upon release. Courts have now halted his deportation, offering a glimmer of hope for the exonerated man.

title: Inside India’s voyeur web: CCTV dashboards hacked; homes, schools on porn sites
content: A shocking cyber scandal has exposed widespread CCTV breaches across India, with hackers exploiting a default password, "admin123," to access intimate footage from hospitals and other institutions. Over 50,000 clips were stolen and sold online, affecting 80 systems nationwide. This highlights critical cybersecurity lapses, with investigations ongoing despite arrests.

title: San Francisco–Delhi flight: Air India to send relief plane; 228 stranded in Mongolia
content: Air India is dispatching a special relief flight to Ulaanbaatar to bring back 228 passengers stranded after their San Francisco-Delhi flight diverted due to a technical issue. The Boeing 787 Dreamliner will ferry the passengers home on Wednesday. The airline is ensuring passenger comfort and safety while the original aircraft undergoes checks.

title: Interpol's red notice against cartel heir; wanted in Rs 13,000cr drug haul
content: Interpol has issued a Red Notice for Rishabh Baisoya, a fugitive linked to a massive Rs 13,000-crore cocaine seizure. Believed to be in the Middle East, Baisoya is accused of facilitating drug transportation for his father's international cartel. Authorities are pursuing a global manhunt and a trial in absentia.

title: ‘Rs 100 crore assets’: UP DySP hidden empire busted; SIT links him to Kanpur extortion gang
content: A Deputy Superintendent of Police in Uttar Pradesh, Rishikant Shukla, faces a vigilance inquiry after an SIT probe uncovered nearly ₹100 crore in alleged illegal wealth. The investigation revealed links to a Kanpur-based lawyer's extortion syndicate, which reportedly used fabricated cases and land grabbing. Shukla's assets are deemed disproportionate to his known income.

title: Kayla Harrison net worth 2025: UFC career, earnings, and latest match updates
content: Kayla Harrison, a two-time Olympic judo champion, has conquered the UFC, clinching the women's bantamweight title in June 2025. Her impressive victory over Julianna Peña, secured by submission, has cemented her status as a formidable force in mixed martial arts.  Harrison's journey, marked by dedication and a winning spirit, continues to inspire.

title: 'A Quiet Place: Day One': OTT release date and where to watch the Lupita Nyong'o starrer
content: A Quiet Place: Day One, starring Lupita Nyong'o and Joseph Quinn, is now available on Netflix. The film explores the beginning of the alien invasion in New York City. Critics have given it a mixed review. Meanwhile, A Quiet Place Part III, directed by John Krasinski, has had its release date moved to July 30, 2027.

title: Polling In Maharashtra Municipal Councils, Local Bodies To Take Place On Dec 2
content: Elections in 246 municipal councils and 42 nagar panchayats in Maharashtra will take place on December 2, and votes will be counted on December 3, State Election Commissioner Dinesh Waghmare said on Tuesday.

title: 400 Cheque Books, 200 Sims: Inside Rs 40 Crore IPO Scam In Mumbai
content: The ED conducted searches at multiple locations in Mumbai as part of investigations against a company that duped investors after providing false assurances to set up data and digital learning centres in small towns, an official said on Tuesday.

title: Live Updates: NYC Votes For Next Mayor As Mamdani, Cuomo, Silwa Face Off
content: NYC Mayoral Election 2025 Live Updates: New York City's voters are set to choose the next mayor to run the country's largest city. The polling stations opened at 6 am local time and will remain open till 9 pm.

title: IIT Bombay Identifies Biomarkers To Predict Kidney Failure in Diabetics
content: Research led by the Indian Institute of Technology Bombay has identified hidden blood biomarkers that can flag early warning signs of diabetic kidney disease.

title: IndiGo Sees Net Loss Of Rs 2,482 Crore For 2nd Quarter Amid Forex Issues
content: The country's largest airline, IndiGo, reported a loss of Rs 2,582.10 crore in the September quarter as higher forex losses and expenses impacted the bottom line, and it expects to induct its first long-range Airbus A321 XLR aircraft in December

title: Chinese Company Kicks Off Trial Production Of Flying Cars, Ahead Of Tesla
content: A Chinese firm this week began trial production of flying cars stated to be the next generation in the world of transportation, ahead of US firm Tesla and others plans to launch the same shortly.

title: 1st Day Of Voter Roll Revision In Bengal Sees Tech Glitches
content: The SIR of electoral rolls began across West Bengal on Tuesday, with over 80,000 booth-level officers visiting homes to distribute enumeration forms, kicking off a politically sensitive exercise ahead of the 2026 assembly polls

title: Philippine Air Force Helicopter Carrying 5 Crashes During Typhoon Rescue
content: A Philippine air force helicopter with five personnel on board crashed Monday in the country's south while flying to help respond to the devastation wrought by Typhoon Kalmaegi.

title: Delhi 6th Most Polluted City In Country In October: Study
content: Delhi was ranked the sixth most polluted city in the country in October, behind neighbouring Ghaziabad and Noida, according to a study.

title: Amid DMK Opposition, Voter List Revision Begins in Tamil Nadu
content: The Special Intensive Revision of voter lists or SIR was rolled out across multiple states today. Among them were Bengal, Kerala and Tamil Nadu - states where assembly elections are due next year.

title: Court Restores Conviction Of Man Earlier Jailed For Cruelty Towards Wife
content: The Madurai BenchoftheMadrasHighCourthas reinstated theconvictionofan86-year-oldmanfor subjecting hiswifetomental and economiccruelty, reversing a previous acquittal.

title: From Trading Business To UK's Richest Family, Gopichand Hinduja's Journey
content: Gopichand P Hinduja, the head of Britain's richest family, who was named as an accused in the Bofors scam with his two brothers, died in London at the age of 85.

title: 'Not Banana Republic': Kerala Court On Police Arresting Man Over 10ml Liquor
content: The Manjeri District Principal Sessions Court on Tuesday slammed the Kerala Police for arresting a 32-year-old man for possessing just 10 millilitres of liquor.

title: Singapore To Introduce Caning For Online Scammers
content: Singapore plans to punish online scammers with at least six strokes with a cane, as the city-state doubles down on syndicates following record-high scam losses.

title: Free Cancellation, Faster Refunds: Aviation Body Proposes 'Passenger-First' Rules
content: Air travellers in India may soon get more flexibility and faster refunds, as the Directorate General of Civil Aviation (DGCA) has proposed new passenger-friendly rules for ticket cancellation and amendments.

title: 1 In 7 Deaths In Delhi In 2023 Linked To Air Pollution, Finds Study
content: Air pollution was responsible for nearly 15 per cent of all deaths in Delhi in 2023, making it the city's single largest health risk, according to an analysis of the latest Global Burden of Disease (GBD) data.

title: 103 Ancient Gold Coins Found During Tamil Nadu Temple Renovation
content: Over 100 ancient gold coins were unearthed from a temple which was under renovation near the Javvadu hills here, police said on Tuesday.

title: Dick Cheney, Former US Vice President And Republican Giant, Dies At 84
content: Dick Cheney, the hard-charging conservative who became one of the most powerful and polarising vice presidents in US history and a leading advocate for the invasion of Iraq, has died at age 84.

title: Liquor-Laden Truck Bound For Bihar Caught In UP's Ballia
content: A Bihar-bound truck was caught with illegal liquor worth almost Rs 17 lakh in Uttar Pradesh's Ballia.

title: India To Hold Tri-Service Exercise 'Poorvi Prachand Prahar' In Arunachal
content: A tri-service exercise to integrate warfighting capability, technological adaptation and operational synergy among the three wings of the armed forces will be held in the rugged mountains of Mechuka in Arunachal Pradesh this month, an official said.

title: How to watch ESPN amid Disney-YouTube TV blackout
content: a blackout of ESPN and other Disney-owned channels, such as ABC, has been reported . the conflict affects ABC, the ESPN netwo and the foxes . if you don't have cable access, you can get instant access to ESPN content through a variety of services .

title: CFP Bubble Watch: Who's in? Who's out? Who's close ahead of first committee ranking?
content: the college football playoff selection committee will reveal its first ranking on tuesday . teams with Would be in status below are featured in this week's top 12 projection . the 12-member selection committee doesn't always agree with the Allstate Playoff P .

title: Tracking every NFL trade deadline move: Logan Wilson to the Cowboys
content: the 2025 trade deadline is Tuesday at 4 p.m. ET, and we have you covered on every deal until the final second . we also have the latest buzz from our team of NFL reporters on which players could be moved next and which teams might be looking to upgrade or add extra draft picks .

title: Way-too-early NBA All-Star predictions﻿: Which new faces will we see in L.A.?
content: the 2025-26 season is young, but it's not too early to start thinking about which players have a chance to join that group . jamal Murray has averaged more points in his playoff career (23.8) than Wilt Chamberlain (22.5), James Harden (22.3), Dwyane Wade (22.3) and Kawhi Leonard (21.6)

title: Free agent pickups: Key adds ahead of Week 10
content: the ninth Sunday of the season featured a wild, defenseless slugfest in Buffalo . preseason top tight end Brock Bowers scored three touchdowns and a league-high 43.3 PPR points . cam Little blasted the longest field goal in NFL history .

title: 🏀 Big questions to impact men's March Madness
content: the first in-season projections of the 2026 March Madness field of 68 will release Nov. 11 . the reasons are that the Big Ten and the SEC have more contenders to chase the respective league favorites . Bracketology is a prisoner of probability and it's simply more likely that Houston and Duke ride the wave of their respective conferences to a No. 1 seed .

title: Cardinals snap losing streak, beat Cowboys in Dallas
content: the Arizona Cardinals beat the Dallas Cowboys 27-10 on "Monday Night Football" the Cardinals' offense looked better and more efficient, both statistically and to the naked eye . the offense topped 300 yards for the third straight game after hitting the mark just once .

title: Resetting the CFP tiers after Week 10 and projecting the first bracket
content: two top-10 teams fell on the road to unranked opponents . a third fell to a lower-ranked team . two-thirds of the 2025 college football season done, we now shift into Playoff Hyperdrive .

title: Government to resolve granite industry issues, says Minister Kollu Ravindra
content: Committee formed with officials and industry representatives to address seigniorage payment concerns; Minister urges factory owners to end strike affecting thousands of workers

title: K-RIDE invites fresh tenders for Mallige Line civil works after L&T contract termination
content: According to K-RIDE officials, the company has now re-invited tenders to complete the pending works of Corridor-2 after the termination by L&T

title: Summit by The Hindu, CPCL to focus on India’s path to a sustainable future
content: The summit aims to bring together leaders, policymakers, and industry experts to foster discussions on environmental responsibility, green innovation, and collaborative policies for a sustainable India

title: APSRTC Union flags overcrowding, manpower shortage in Stree Shakti buses
content: Leaders urge addition of 3,000 buses and 10,000 staff to ease burden on drivers and conductors; seek timely reimbursement of ₹250 crore monthly dues under the women’s free travel scheme

title: A.P. CM discusses potential tie-ups with India’s High Commissioner in U.K.
content: Talks focus on strengthening trade relations, education collaboration, innovation, entrepreneurship, and diaspora engagement

title: ₹113 crore sanctioned for infrastructure development in tribal schools, says Andhra Pradesh Minister Sandhya Rani
content: Of this, ₹83 crore is allocated to tribal ashram schools and ₹30 crore to gurukulam schools, she says

title: Priti Kinar, a transgender candidate of Prashant Kishor’s party, aims high
content: The JSP candidate is pitted against Bhorey’s sitting MLA Sunil Kumar, the State’s Education Minister and a former IPS officer; former JNUSU president Dhananjay Kumar is also in the fray as a CPI (ML)(L) candidate

title: All set for ‘Karthika Pournami’ festivities in Srisailam
content: Srisailam temple Executive Officer directs officials to ensure that there is no stampede-like situation in the queue lines and to work in coordination

title: NDA government in Andhra Pradesh pursuing anti-farmer policies, says YSRCP president Jagan Mohan Reddy
content: The State government has dismantled the crop insurance mechanism, leaving lakhs of farmers without support, he says, demanding the mmediately release crop insurance payments, along with pending dues of ₹600 crore

title: SC to examine if bar on surrogacy for a second child is state intrusion in citizens' private lives
content: Centre says there is no fundamental right to surrogacy, which involves the use of another woman’s body; petitioner says secondary fertility is an emotionally challenging issue, notes that there is no one-child policy in the country

title: Viksit Bharat scheme to generate 3.5 crore new jobs
content: The PMVBRY, launched under the vision of Viksit Bharat @2047, provides incentives both to employees and employers to encourage formal job creation

title: BJP and BNP slam tunnel road project; call for focus on public transport
content: Both parties have accused the Congress government of prioritising a ‘lucrative’ and ‘unscientific’ project over the city’s genuine mobility needs

title: Karnataka govt. not paying salary grants to HDMC, alleges MLA Tenginakai
content: Hubballi Dharwad Central MLA Mahesh Tenginakai has alleged that the state government had not released the salary grants to Hubballi Dharwad Municipal Corporation from the last six months.

title: Meet Akkai Padmashali, first transgender person from Karnataka to be part of SC-appointed panel
content: Trans rights activist Akkai Padmashali speaks about being named as a member of a Supreme Court-appointed committee.

title: TUDA proposes 60% funding for development works to urban local bodiess
content: The proposal, however, will come to light only if the urban local bodies agree to bear the remaining 40 per cent of the total cost

title: Agriculture Minister Atchannaidu slams YSRCP MP for ‘politicising’ farmers’ issues
content: Questioning Avinash Reddy’s ‘sudden concern’, the Minister asserts the government has already taken unprecedented measures to protect the onion farmers

title: Bilaspur train accident: Rescue ops under way; emergency numbers issued
content: the incident occurred near Bilaspur railway station . the railway administration has taken swift action to initiate relief and rescue operations on a war footing . injured have been shifted to nearby hospitals for immediate medical assistance . ex-gratia compensation has been announced for the affected persons .

title: Chhattisgarh train accident: Toll reaches 7; compensation of 10 lakh announced
content: The TOI News Desk comprises a dedicated and tireless team of journalists who operate around the clock to deliver the most current and comprehensive news and updates to the readers of The Times of India worldwide. With an unwavering commitment to excellence in journalism, our team is at the forefront of gathering, verifying, and presenting breaking news, in-depth analysis, and insightful reports on a wide range of topics. The TOI News Desk is your trusted source for staying informed and connected to the ever-evolving global landscape, ensuring that our readers are equipped with the latest developments that matter most." Read More

title: Congress faces backlash over Punjab unit chief’s remark on Buta Singh
content: Opposition parties and commissions seek action; Warring issues unconditional apology ahead of Tarn Taran byelection

title: Government General Hospital-Khammam adopts e-queue system to tackle rising patient load
content: Under the new system, patients collecting their OP registration slips can approach the help desk, where volunteers issue electronic tokens generated by the queue management machine

title: To deal with tariffs, focus on becoming more competitive, says CEA
content: Mr. Nageswaran added that diversification of export markets and the ongoing negotiations, among other things, are other imperatives to address the challenges

title: TDP leadership directs warring leaders to maintain discipline
content: Vijayawada MP Kesineni Sivanath and Tiruvuru MLA Kolikapudi Srinivas Rao appear before the party disciplinary committee

title: National honour for Chittoor constable in crime investigation
content: Of the 26 police personnel representing Andhra Pradesh, Raghuraman’s services were specially acknowledged

title: Girl gang raped in Assam’s Tinsukia while returning from school
content: According to the victim’s statement, three men raped and dumped her on the roadside while she was returning home from school, an officer said

title: For these baiyyas in Chennai, poll promises from Bihar are made to be broken
content: The BJP and the RJD may be wooing voters by promising crores of government jobs in Bihar, but migrant workers from the State based in Chennai are taking the neta natter with a pinch of salt

title: Two poachers, wild boar found electrocuted in Bangarupalem mandal
content: According to police, unidentified persons laid power cables in the mango orchard to hunt wild boars and antelopes, which the duo failed to notice, resulting in their instant death

title: Will the LDF retain its bastion of Neyyattinkara?
content: The municipality has been an LDF stronghold since the 1970s with the Congress-led United Democratic Front (UDF) scoring an upset only once, in 2010.

title: In a first for Visva-Bharati, varsity wants to build direct bridge with industry
content: The university seeks to formally build a bridge between academia and industry to boost employment opportunities for its students

title: Telangana weather: Warmer nights, slightly hotter days in November
content: IMD’s forecast indicates minimum temperatures across most parts of the country will remain above normal this month

title: Nigerian arrested for peddling MDMA and cocaine worth ₹75 lakh in Bengaluru
content: The accused had bought MDMA tablets and cocaine from an unidentified supplier in the city and sold them at higher prices to college students and other customers

title: International conference on multi disciplinary research and innovation at G.M. University from Nov. 6
content: Renowned experts, academicians, researchers, entrepreneurs and professionals from India and abroad are expected to participate in the International Conference ‘Confluence-2025’  on theme “Advancing Sustainability through Multidisciplinary Research and Innovation” to be hosted by G.M. University in Davangere on November 6, 7 and 8.

title: Make effective use of SASCI funds to improve rural roads, Andhra Pradesh Deputy CM Pawan Kalyan tells officials
content: Advising officials not to compromise on quality of works, the Deputy Chief Minister says he will conduct field inspections along with technical experts, and irregularities, if any, will not be tolerated

title: ‘Why did God take away my three daughters?’: Telangana bus crash shatters a father’s world
content: Just two weeks after celebrating his eldest child’s wedding, Tandoor resident Edigi Yellaiah cremated his three daughters within hours of each other. The sisters were among 17 killed when a speeding lorry rammed a TSRTC bus on Hyderabad outskirts on Monday

title: Medical PG student’s rented room turns into drug storage and sales hub
content: Dr. Joseph Paul, 29, a final-year student in forensic medicine was arrested by State Task Force (STF) officials who seized synthetic and imported narcotics worth around ₹3 lakh from his room

title: CPI(M) seeks establishment of Sports University in Andhra Pradesh
content: In letter to HRD Minister Lokesh, party State secretary Srinivasa Rao says such a facility will help promote sports and nurture talent at the grassroots

title: Talks between sugarcane growers and management of factories hit a deadlock in Belagavi
content: Talks between farmers and the management of sugar factories hit a deadlock after they failed to reach an agreement over the price to be fixed for sugarcane this season

title: Telangana, Cuba keen on forging strong ties
content: IT and Industries Minister D. Sridhar Babu and Ambassador of Cuba Juan Carlos Marsan Aguilera discuss scope for collaboration in biotech, pharma, healthcare, AI, IT, innovation, agriculture, sports and culture

title: Women abused, shamed, and silenced online by technology-facilitated gender-based violence, says report
content: India needs stronger online safety laws, faster removal of abusive content, and more accountability from tech platforms, a report by international human rights organisations highlights

title: Incapable DMK administration led to breakdown of law and order in T.N., alleges Nainar Nagenthran
content: By merely shooting and catching the accused, what is the use, asks BJP leader in response to the arrest of Coimbatore gang-rape accused

title: Hyderabad gets 24x7 postal booking counters at railway stations, airport
content: The initiative allows citizens to access a range of postal services, including Speed Post, parcels, business mail and other postal facilities, at any hour
